repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers are primarily comprised of text and scores from Egyptian comedy theater productions and correspondence regarding Kassār's professional career.

langmaterial.language: The entire collection is in Arabic.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased by the Near East curator from Leila Bookshop, Cairo, Egypt, 2005.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has been transferred to Yale University for unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection. prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: ʻAlī Kassār Papers (MS 1875). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in five series: I. Plays: Scores and text, 1918-1938. II. Plays: Scores only, 1937, n.d. III. Plays: Text only, n.d. IV. Professional and personal, 1930-2003, n.d. V. Videos, 2004, n.d.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: ʻAli Kassār was born on June 13,1887, in Cairo's old traditional neighborhood of al Sayyidah Zaynab. His original name was ʻAli Khalil Salim Ibrahim. At the beginning of his career in 1908, he worked for al-Zaynabi Acting Company. In 1916 he founded his first troupe under his own name at the Casino de Paris theater located in 'Imad al Din street. He played his very famous character "Uthman al-Barbari" for the first time in 1916 in the play entitled, "Hasan Abu ʻAli Sarak al-Mi'zah." He used this character in many of his plays to criticize the political situation in Egypt. He also worked with famous composers, including Sayyid Darwish, from 1919 until the latter's death in 1923. After that he worked with Zakariya Ahmad from 1924 to 1929. In 1950 he dismissed his band and started working for the public theater that was founded and managed by the government of Egypt.

ʻAli Kassār ̄is considered the founder of comedy theater not only in Egypt, but in the Arab world. He worked in the theater for about fifty years and performed in about thirty movies. He passed away on January 15, 1957, at al-Qasr al-ʻAyni Hospital in Cairo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Papers are primarily comprised of text and scores from Egyptian comedy theater productions and correspondence regarding Kassār's professional career.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research. Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged chronologically and within year alphabetically by author/translator, and withinauthor/translator alphabetically by title. Authors/translators who are unknown are placed at the end of files for specific years. Plays with no dates are arranged at the end of the series alphabetically by author/translator. The series includes plays in which KassÄr acted but did not write, and plays he both wrote and in which he acted. Folder titles include the name of the author/translator and the title of the play in quotation marks. Each file is comprised of text and a musical score.

did.unittitle: Ibrahim, Zaki and Zaki al-sayyid, Ahmad, "Amer ibn al 'as"
Sidqi, Amin, "Ana lak wa inta liya"

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged alphabetically by composer/translator, and within composer/translator, alphabetically by title. Scores for which the composer/translator are unknown are arranged at the end of the series, alphabetically by title. The files consist of scores only.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is arranged alphabtically by title. Authors/translators and years of creation are unknown. The files consist only of text.

did.unittitle: Contracts [re: hiring actors, renting theaters, etc.]
Ali al-kassar fi zaman 'imad al-din [by Majid al-kassar]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series is comprised of videos of films in which ʻAlī Kassār acted. They are arranged alphabetically by title.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original audiovisual materials, as well as preservation and duplicating masters, may not be played. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist must pay for a use copy, which is retained by the repository. Researchers wishing to obtain an additional copy for their personal use should consult Copying Services information on the Manuscripts and Archives web site.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copies of commercially produced audiovisual materials in this series cannot be made for researcher use outside of the repository.

did.unittitle: Nur al -din wa al-baharah al thalathah [PAL]
